content: The ancient city of Petra, carved into red sandstone cliffs, is located in which modern-day country?

Petra, the ancient city carved into red sandstone cliffs, is located in the modern-day country of Jordan. This remarkable archaeological site is famous for its rock-cut architecture and water conduit system, and it was originally established as the capital city of the Nabataean Kingdom around the 6th century BC. Today, Petra is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the New Seven Wonders of the World, attracting visitors from all over the globe who come to marvel at its stunning beauty and rich history.
